content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Maloney Keady Opticians in Castlerea, we pride ourselves on providing a thoroughly professional and friendly service to all our patients.

Our aim is that you feel confident with your eyecare and you receive the service you expect.

We are looking for a full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care. This role will be working Monday – Friday. No Saturday working.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €14.00

Salary – Min

EUR €14.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Your vision impacts every aspect of your life and at Straine Opticians, we are committed to helping you achieve the best quality of life possible. We deliver a comprehensive range of eye care services.

We’re looking for a part-time Optometrist to work 2 days a week. The annual salary is £55,000 pro rata.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 45 minutes
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT and topographer
  • We are a team of 6
  • The role requires you to 3 in 4 Saturdays month

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £55,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

title.rendered: Optical Assistant job in St Albans

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Established in Stotfold in 1984, Paul Adler Optometrist expanded by opening a second practice in St Albans in 2006.

We are a family-friendly practice offering eyecare services for all ages. We provide a comprehensive service and take great care to ensure our patients receive the attention they need.

With a strong focus on patient care and service, our team of experienced opticians is dedicated to providing the highest quality eye care. Our optometrists and vision care specialists are well-respected in the optical profession for their extensive knowledge.

We are looking for an Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team, helping us enhance our services while continuously seeking opportunities for improvement and innovation.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience.

Additional Information

  • We are a team of eight.
  • This role requires you to work on Saturdays (09:00–13:00).
  • Part-time – 4.5 days per week.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £26,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £24,500.00

What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

As a Dispensing Assistant or, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Millicans Opticians we place a high emphasis on clinical care and perform not only an ‘eye test’ but a thorough examination of your eyes both internally and externally.

We are seeking a full time Dispensing Optician, although 4 days will be considered.

We are a family run, independent opticians, who have been caring for the eye health of residents across the Halton District since 1990.

We love getting to know the people who visit our practice, and over the years, we have learned that everybody’s needs are unique.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Fors, RayBan, Lindberg
  • The role requires you to work 2 Saturdays a month
  • Previous experience within the optical industry is required

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

title.rendered: Optical Assistant – maternity cover job in Loughton

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.


Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or just starting out, we offer the tools to help you develop your skills and advance your career.

Join our thriving practice and grow with us.

At Bird & Fairley, we pride ourselves on being a community-based practice that truly takes the time to care for our patients.

Located in the affluent area of Loughton, our practice faces a competitive optical market, so we go the extra mile to ensure our patients receive top-notch care.

With easy access, we’re just a 12-minute walk from the nearest Central Line station, making commuting convenient.

This role is a 1 year temporary contract to cover for a maternity leave.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working

  • Private medical insurance

  • Cycle to work scheme

  • One free pair of spectacles per year

About the Role

We are looking for a part-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care, 3 days a week in Loughton.
This role is a temporary 1 year contract to cover for a maternity leave.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • The working days are Mondays, Tuesdays & Saturdays
    • Opening hours: 9 am -5:30 pm
  • You will work alongside two excellent Dispensing Opticians, both have been in the business for years.
  • Modern technology that you will be trained on to deliver tailor-made lenses
  • Any support needed for you to develop your skills

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £26,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £24,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

At Mincher Lockett Opticians and Malcolm Gray & Associates, we care deeply about eye health and about you as an individual. We place great emphasis on providing personalised eye care tailored to each patient, using the latest techniques and state-of-the-art equipment.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patients are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too. We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

The role can be based at either Mincher Lockett Opticians (18-20 Stafford Street, Stafford, ST16 2BP) or Malcolm Gray & Associates (56 High Street, Stafford, ST21 6BZ).

We are seeking a full-time or part-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

About the Role

You will be an integral part of our team, helping us drive our service forward and always seeking opportunities to improve and innovate. We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and who is willing to invest the time needed to fully understand their visual needs.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience.

Additional Information:

  • The role requires some Saturday work, with an early finish, but no Sundays or bank holidays
  • 40-minute testing times
  • Performance and sales-related bonuses paid quarterly

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £54,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £50,000.00

title.rendered: Optical Assistant Receptionist job in Cumbria

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Trotman Opticians in Wigton Cumbria, we focus on providing the highest quality eye care for everyone. We’re passionate about helping our patients find the perfect eyewear for their needs, whether it’s a stylish frame for everyday or a frame that offers the latest technology in vision correction.

We are seeking a personable and committed Part time Optical Assistant to work 3 days a week with our welcoming and experienced team. Essentially, we need someone who has excellent customer service and communication skills.

Our friendly reception team, experienced dispensers, and long-standing optometrist are always on hand to provide you with the best care and advice.

You will be an integral part of our team, helping us enhance our services while continuously seeking opportunities for improvement and innovation.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience.

Additional Information:

  • We are a team of 7
  • This role will require you to work Saturdays (09:00–13:00)
  • Part-time – 3 days a week

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £12.21

Salary – Min

GBP £12.21

title.rendered: Mobile Optometrist – Independent Opticians job in Milton Keynes

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Mobile Optometrist role, DW Roberts – Bletchley, Newport Pagnell, Stony Stratfford, Towcester and Wolverton.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives, DW Roberts Opticians is a local, family friendly, independent group of practices. We have been providing private and NHS services for the local community in Milton Keynes and South Northants for over 60 years.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses, and as an independent practice group, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

You’ll be working across the DW Roberts practices, supporting our teams by providing a stellar service to our incredibly friendly and loyal patients.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice

You will also receive:

  • Your Birthday Off Work
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday working
  • Free & Regular CPD Courses
  • Access to SimplyHealth (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail Discounts
  • Cycle to Work Scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Mobile Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs. Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 35 mins
  • The role requires you to work some Saturdays
  • Salary is dependent on experience

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

title.rendered: Lens Category Manager job in Darwen

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Joining Hakim Group means becoming part of a close-knit family of independent Optical practices across the UK and Ireland.

A career where empowerment, innovation, and unwavering support create a truly fulfilling experience. A career that’s not just fulfilling but a bit like joining a secret club of the happiest eye-care professionals. We are seeking a Lens Category Manager to lead continuous improvement.

You will also receive:

  • Exciting calendar of events, fostering a vibrant work culture.
  • Employee health plan to prioritise your well-being.
  • Access to our financial flexibility fund, providing additional support when needed.
  • Rewards portal with exclusive benefits and offers.
  • Embrace a supportive and expanding team, immersing yourself in our award-winning Hakim Group culture.

About the Role

Lens Category Manager is a brand-new role at Hakim Group. You’ll lead category planning and execution for Lens. Supporting our practice teams to grow sales and margins via approved brands and build meaningful relationships with 3rd parties to optimise a multi-year category plan.

You’ll have the opportunity to innovate the ways we work and contribute to our continued growth.

This role is Hybrid with 2 days per week at our HQ in Darwen. BB3 1AE

Key Roles & Responsibilities

You will be working closely with our practice partners and suppliers, supporting them as Lens Category Manager

  • Take ownership of your category by managing the approved and recommended supplier list while driving improvements.
  • Work with a diverse group of internal and external stakeholders to identify efficiencies, opportunities, and improvements for both practices and patients
  • Identify and implement projects aimed at enhancing category performance.
  • Build meaningful relationships with 3rd parties to develop partnership relations that hold Hakim Group customers at the forefront.
  • Lead the development of tools and resources to enable our independent practices to optimise patient experience.
  • Identify insights and trends related to the market, consumers and competitors, in order to maximise margins and discover new opportunities.

The Ideal Candidate

You’ll be customer-focused with great communication skills. You will have a clear understanding of the optical industry and the lens category. Having previous experience in a similar role. Comfortable with building category plans and working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Using your analytical skills to inform and support strategic recommendations

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £55,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £45,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

We would prefer an experienced Optical Assistant however we can provide in house training. We can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Established in Stotfold in 1984, Paul Adler Optometrist opened a second practice in St Albans in 2006.

We are family-friendly practices offering eye care services from babies through to seniors. We provide a comprehensive service and pride ourselves on taking the time to ensure our patients receive the care and attention they need.

We are looking for a full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care at our Stotfold branch.

You will be an integral part of our team, helping us drive our service offering forward and always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also seeking someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and is willing to spend the time needed to fully understand their visual needs.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Bevel, Pro Design, Ted Baker, William Morris, Wolf, and more.
  • The role requires you to work on Saturdays.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the positive impact of our work when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £13.50

Salary – Min

GBP £12.50

title.rendered: Dispensing Optician Practice Manager job in Cornwall

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician Practice Manager, you’ll be equipped with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Dispensing Optician Practice Manager to join us in leading the team to delivering outstanding patient care.

What We’re Looking For:

  • A Dispensing Optician with a passion for delivering high-quality care.

    • You’re dedicated to providing expert advice on eyewear and lens options, ensuring patients receive the best solution for their needs.

  • A patient-focused approach with a friendly, empathetic manner.

    • You build strong relationships with patients, ensuring they feel confident and well-cared for throughout their experience.

  • A willingness to take on a leadership role and grow within a supportive team.

    • You’re ready to take the next step into management, using your dispensing experience to lead and mentor the optical team.

  • A team player who thrives in a local, independent practice setting.

    • You’ll work closely with optometrists and support staff to deliver a seamless and professional service.

We are committed to helping dispensing opticians develop their careers and transition into management roles, providing ongoing support and opportunities for growth.

About Us

Andrew Keirl Opticians is an independent practice known for delivering personalised and high-quality eye care services. Located in Liskeard, a historic market town in Cornwall, the practice serves the local community with a range of optical services, including comprehensive eye exams, eyewear fittings, and contact lens consultations. The team is dedicated to providing a friendly, professional experience for each patient.

Liskeard is easily accessible by car and public transport. It’s close to the A38, offering convenient links to nearby towns such as Plymouth (around 30 minutes’ drive) and other areas of Cornwall. Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Practice Manager, you will be equipped with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to lead your team to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Practice Manager to join us in leading the team to delivering outstanding patient care.

What We’re Looking For:

  • A Retail Manager with a passion for delivering high-quality customer service.

    • You’ve thrived in retail management roles and are now looking to bring your skills into a healthcare setting, ensuring an exceptional customer experience.

  • A patient-focused approach with a friendly, empathetic manner.

    • You understand the importance of personalised service and will create a welcoming environment for all patients.

  • A willingness to learn and grow within a supportive team.

    • You’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills in healthcare management while leveraging your retail experience.

  • A team player who thrives in a local, independent practice setting.

    • You’ll work closely with our optometrists and optical staff to ensure smooth operations and a high standard of care.

We are committed to supporting experienced retail managers in transitioning into opticians’ practice management and achieving professional growth with us.

About Us

Andrew Keirl Opticians is an independent practice known for delivering personalised and high-quality eye care services. Located in Liskeard, a historic market town in Cornwall, the practice serves the local community with a range of optical services, including comprehensive eye exams, eyewear fittings, and contact lens consultations. The team is dedicated to providing a friendly, professional experience for each patient.

Liskeard is easily accessible by car and public transport. It’s close to the A38, offering convenient links to nearby towns such as Plymouth (around 30 minutes’ drive) and other areas of Cornwall. The town also has a well-connected train station, making the commute easier for those traveling from surrounding areas.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Bird Eyewear, Guess, Maui Jim and more.

  • We are a team of 5

  • We are currently closed on weekends; this could be subject to change in the future, due to business growth. Please expect alternate Saturdays, in case our business hours are updated.

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £27,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £27,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Parkstone Eyecare, based in the beautiful coastal town of Poole, is seeking a dedicated full-time or part-time optometrist to join our dynamic team.

As part of the Hakim Group, you’ll not only have the chance to grow within a thriving practice but also benefit from the support and development opportunities offered by one of the UK’s leading independent optical groups.

What’s in it for you?

  • Specialist Services: At Parkstone Eyecare, we specialise in colorimetry, a cutting-edge method used to improve reading and visual comfort for individuals experiencing visual stress and related conditions. You’ll have the opportunity to work with advanced tools, conducting thorough, personalised assessments to provide life-changing solutions for patients. From diagnosing visual stress to prescribing custom-tinted overlays and lenses, your work will have a direct impact on patients’ quality of life.

  • Career Development: For the right person, there is the opportunity to become a Joint Venture Partner (JVP). This is an incredible chance to take your career to the next level by becoming a co-owner of the practice, leading the future of Parkstone Eyecare alongside an exceptional team.

About Us

Parkstone Eyecare is committed to providing the same top-notch eye care services to the community that have been provided by both teams over the numerous years we have been open. Our team of professionals is dedicated to maintaining the highest standards in eye health, ensuring every patient receives personalised and effective care.

Our opening hours are Mon-Fri 9 am-5 pm, and 8.45 am – 12.45 pm on Saturdays.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes a seperate pre screen area with OCT and Optomap.
  • We are an experienced team including 2 dispensing opticians
  • Easy and accessible parking

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £57,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Optometrist – Silverthornes Opticians, Salisbury

Location: Salisbury, Wiltshire
Position: Full-Time Optometrist, Monday to Friday
Salary: Competitive, dependent on experience + Professional Fees Paid + Welcome/Relocation Bonus
Benefits: Partnership Opportunities, Supportive Team, Loyal Patient Base

Are you a passionate and skilled Optometrist looking to join a friendly, established, and independent practice? Silverthornes Opticians, a well-loved community optician in the beautiful city of Salisbury, is looking for a dedicated professional to join our expert team.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Relocation or Welcome Bonus of £5000
  • Professional Fees paid
  • Future partnership opportunity

About the Role

Why Silverthornes Opticians?

  • Independent Practice: We pride ourselves on delivering a truly personalised service to our patients. As an independent practice, we have the freedom to focus on what matters most – the health and wellbeing of our patients.
  • Loyal Patient Base: You’ll have the opportunity to care for a long-standing, loyal patient database that appreciates quality care and attention.
  • Supportive Team: You will be working alongside an experienced and dedicated team of professionals who are committed to both patient care and supporting each other.
  • Partnership Opportunities: We believe in investing in the future of our practice. For the right candidate, there may be partnership opportunities available.
  • Professional Development: Your professional fees will be fully covered, and we support continuous learning and development.
  • Welcome/Relocation Bonus: If you’re moving to join us, we offer a welcome or relocation bonus to help make your transition smoother.

The Role:

As a Optometrist at Silverthornes Opticians, you’ll play a vital role in providing expert advice and care, offering tailored solutions to meet the individual needs of our patients. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Conducting comprehensive eye examinations fully equipped with 40 minutes test times and modern equipment including OCT
  • 2 consulting rooms
  • Diagnosing and managing ocular conditions while offering tailored treatment plans
  • Providing expert advice on vision correction options, including glasses and contact lenses
  • Building long-lasting relationships with patients by offering exceptional care and attention

About Salisbury:

Situated in the heart of Wiltshire, Salisbury is a historic and vibrant cathedral city, renowned for its stunning architecture and close proximity to the world-famous Stonehenge. With excellent transport links to London and the South West, Salisbury offers the perfect blend of city living and countryside charm. Enjoy a fantastic work-life balance with access to cultural landmarks, beautiful parks, and a thriving local community.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Optometrist, registered with the GOC
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • A commitment to providing exceptional patient care
  • Ability to work efficiently and collaboratively in a team environment
  • A desire to grow with the practice and embrace potential partnership opportunities

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Optical Assistant at Sheppard & Akay

Shephard & Akay Optometrists, established in 1975, is a well respected independent practice in Hitchin, Hertfordshire, offering exceptional NHS and private eye care services. We specialise in fitting a variety of contact lenses, including astigmatism, multifocal, and medical lenses, and offer an extensive selection of branded frames.

With a reputation for professionalism and a strong community presence, Shephard & Akay Optometrists is dedicated to maintaining excellent patient relationships and delivering comprehensive eye care.

We are looking for a passionate, dedicated individual to join our friendly team and help maintain our high standards of patient care.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full/part-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Ford, Lindberg, Paul Smith, Oliver Peoples, Silhouette, Kate Spade
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 10
  • The role requires you to work up to 4 Saturday mornings a month (9-2)

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £22,750.00

Salary – Min

GBP £22,222.00

title.rendered: Dispensing Optician/Experienced Optical Assistant job in Lucan

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Mullins & Henry Opticians in Lucan, we are all happy to attend to our customers’ optical needs from the moment you step into our practice. Lucan, located in the stunning valley of the River Liffey in west Dublin, is eight miles from the city center.

We are a well-established independent practice looking to recruit an experienced Dispensing Optician, although we also welcome applications from experienced Optical Assistants.

It’s important that you are kind, hardworking, and compassionate, and that you take pride in delivering excellent customer service. Essentially, you should be an excellent team player with a proven ability to multitask.

This is a full-time role with the requirement to work Saturdays.

  • Prior experience in optics is essential.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge, and we look forward to meeting it head-on with you as part of our team.

Our local community is part of our identity here, and we constantly see the benefits of our work when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €0.00

Salary – Min

EUR €0.00

What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

About the Role

KERR EYECARE – OPTOMETRISTS, OPTICIANS AND CONTACT LENS EXPERTS

We have been delivering the highest professional standards of eye care to the local community for more than 70 years. We continue to apply these high standards to the many new clinical and technological developments that are demanded by modern eyecare.

We are looking for a full-time Dispensing Optician or Experienced Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Previous experience in optics is essential.
  • The role requires you to work 3 Saturdays a month

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

title.rendered: Experienced Optical Assistant job in Brighton

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Experienced Optical Assistant – Frames in the Lanes, Brighton

Are you an experienced Optical Assistant looking for a role in a unique and vibrant independent opticians? Frames in the Lanes is on the lookout for a passionate and customer-focused individual to join our team in the heart of Brighton’s iconic Lanes

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

About Us

We’re not your typical opticians—we pride ourselves on offering a carefully curated selection of stylish, independent eyewear brands in a relaxed and welcoming environment. Our boutique practice is all about personal service, helping our customers find frames that not only suit their vision needs but also their personality and style.

The Role

As an Experienced Optical Assistant, you’ll be an integral part of our friendly team, providing expert advice and outstanding customer service. Your responsibilities will include:

✔️ Assisting customers in selecting the perfect eyewear, offering honest and knowledgeable style advice
✔️ Carrying out fittings and adjustments to ensure comfort and correct vision
✔️ Processing orders and handling prescriptions with accuracy and attention to detail
✔️ Booking and managing appointments to keep our practice running smoothly
✔️ Handling payments and processing transactions
✔️ Keeping up-to-date with the latest eyewear trends and brands
✔️ Helping with merchandising and maintaining our stylish boutique space

What We’re Looking For

🔹 Previous experience as an Optical Assistant is essential
🔹 A passion for eyewear and fashion, with a keen eye for style
🔹 Excellent customer service and communication skills
🔹 Confidence in working with prescriptions and adjustments
🔹 A friendly and professional attitude

The Details

📍 Location: Frames in the Lanes, Brighton – based in the famous Lanes, our boutique is surrounded by fantastic cafes, independent shops, and just a short walk from Brighton Station. We’re well connected by public transport, with easy access to buses and trains.

💷 Salary: £25,000- £27,000 DOE

🕰 Working Pattern: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday & Saturday

If you love eyewear, enjoy working in a quirky and creative environment, and want to be part of a passionate team, we’d love to hear from you!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £27,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £25,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Hughes Opticians is a well-established, community-focused practice known for delivering high-quality eye care.
We are now looking to add an optical assistant to our team of 3, working Monday-Friday in Bideford, Devon.

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Enjoy Your Birthday Off – Celebrate your special day with a paid day off, because we believe in work-life balance and making every milestone count!
  • No weekend or Bank Holiday Work – Relish your weekends and holidays with loved ones.
  • Complimentary & Ongoing CPD Courses – Stay ahead in your career with free, regular CPD courses. We invest in your growth and success!
  • Simply Health Access – Prioritize your wellbeing with access to Simply Health, allowing you to claim cashback on healthcare purchases and keep your health expenses manageable.
  • Exclusive Retail Discounts – Unlock savings on your everyday shopping with special retail discounts, making life just that little bit sweeter.
  • Cycle to Work Scheme – Embrace a greener, healthier commute with our cycle-to-work program, saving on transport costs while staying fit.

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care Monday-Friday, in Bideford, Devon.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Ford, Ted Baker, Oakley, Ray-Ban and William Morris
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 3
  • This role is Monday to Friday with 9am to 5pm opening hours.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £12.50

Salary – Min

GBP £11.44

title.rendered: Dispensing Optician/Experienced Optical Assistant job in Dublin

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Mullins & Henry was established in 1982 and has proudly been serving Maynooth as your local opticians for many years. We offer a comprehensive range of eye care services, including enhanced eye tests, children’s eye examinations, retinal photography, tonometry, visual field tests, colour vision assessments, contact lens expertise, and much more.

At Mullins & Henry, our focus is on your eye care—our top priority. We provide a highly professional service to all our customers, a commitment we’ve upheld for the past 40 years.

We are currently looking for a full-time Dispensing Optician or Experienced Optical Assistant to join our team and help us deliver exceptional patient care.

You will play an integral role in our team, helping to drive our service forward while always seeking opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re looking for someone who shares our passion for putting patients first and who takes the time to understand their visual needs fully.

About Us

We are a dedicated, independent practice committed to delivering high-quality care and an exceptional experience to our patients.

Additional Information:

  • The role requires you to work on Saturdays.
  • Previous experience in optics is essential.

Our local community is at the heart of our practice, and we continually see the positive impact of our work when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €0.00

Salary – Min

EUR €0.00

title.rendered: Optical Assistant Receptionist job in Waterford

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Major Opticians are one of the longest practicing opticians in the south east of Ireland, in business since 1975.

We are looking for a Full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • We are a team of 4.
  • The role requires you to be available to work Saturdays.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €14.00

Salary – Min

EUR €13.50

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Join Our Team as an Optical Advisor – Unlock Your Career in Optics!

Are you passionate about customer service and interested in starting a career in optics? At Haine & Smith Opticians, we’re offering an exciting Optical Advisor role where you can grow, learn, and thrive in the world of eye care!

Why Haine & Smith?

Career Progression – No experience? No problem! We provide full training and the potential to progress to dispensing spectacles with further training.
Competitive Pay – Earn up to £11.44 per hour, in line with the National Living Wage.
Supportive Environment – Work within a friendly and professional team, committed to delivering exceptional patient care.
Variety & Opportunity – A role with diverse responsibilities and opportunities to develop new skills in the optical industry.

You will also receive:

  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Retail discounts

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in our practice in Tetbury.

Your Role Includes:

Welcoming patients and scheduling appointments

Conducting pre-screening eye tests and helping new contact lens wearers

Assisting with frame styling and performing minor repairs and adjustments Managing practice admin including invoicing, NHS payments, and balancing the till

Maintaining a high standard of practice cleanliness and merchandising displays Delivering exceptional customer service, ensuring patients feel valued and cared for

What We’re Looking For:

Customer service experience with a professional and friendly approach Strong communication skills and the ability to build rapport with patients

Teamwork – Collaborate well and provide support to colleagues Attention to detail and the ability to stay organised in a busy practice GCSEs Grade C (5) or above; this is preferred but not essential

Flexibility – Willingness to adapt to changing needs and assist across multiple practices Ready to Start Your Career in Optics? Apply now at haineandsmith.co.uk/careers and become a part of a team that’s committed to providing excellent patient care and professional growth.

Start your journey with us and unlock exciting career opportunities in optics!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £11.44

Salary – Min

GBP £11.44

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Join Our Warm and Friendly Team at Pullen and Symes Opticians

Are you an someone looking for an exciting opportunity in a warm and friendly environment? Pullen and Symes Opticians is seeking a part-time Optical Assistant who wants to feel valued as part of both our teams in Ottery & Exeter.

About Us: Pullen and Symes Opticians is a well-established business having practices in both Ottery St Mary and Exeter. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional eye care services to our community. With a reputation for excellence, we offer a range of treatments including myopia control, Ortho K and dry eye clinics, ensuring our patients receive the best care possible.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a part-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in both of our practices in Ottery & Exeter.

This role is requiring you to work 4 days a week and alternate Saturdays between both practices.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Lindberg, Tom Ford, Faceaface and others.
  • The role requires you to work 2 in 4 Saturdays a month
  • This role is 33.75h per week

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £13.50

Salary – Min

GBP £12.21

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Dispensing Optician at Davis Opticians – Thrapston

Davis Opticians, a trusted and family friendly independent optician, has been proudly serving the local communities since the 1960’s. With five well established practices in our group, we provide a comprehensive range of private and NHS services, including sight tests, contact lenses, and an extensive selection of frames and lenses.

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a part time Dispensing Optician to join our team.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Ford, Lindberg, Gotti and more
  • The role requires you to work alternate Saturdays
  • Salary depending on level of experience

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Kent Eye Care is a family-run, independent optometry practice that has been serving the community for over eighteen years. We take pride in offering high-quality eye care services, including a home visiting domiciliary service that caters to patients across Ken

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Professional Fees and Insurances Paid

About the Role

Our Practice

We have very close links with local GPs and Hospital consultant ophthalmologists, and provide a NHS emergency acute ophthalmology service(APCOS) looking after GP surgeries and their patients across the whole of Kent & Medway CCG.

The Role

We are seeking a dedicated Part-Time Optometrist to join our team and contribute to our mission of delivering outstanding patient care. As an integral member of our practice, you will:

  • Prioritise Patient Care: Spend the necessary time to thoroughly understand and address each patient’s visual needs.

  • Innovate and Improve: Continuously seek opportunities to enhance our services and introduce innovative solutions.

  • Engage with the Community: Act as an ambassador for our brand and the optometry profession within the local community, educating others about the benefits of eye care.

Key Details

  • Test Times: 30-minute test times across 2 consulting rooms.

  • Advanced Equipment: Utilisation of state-of-the-art testing equipment, including Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT), Slit Lamp, Tonometer, Hospital Standard Fields, Fundus Photography

  • Team Environment: Collaborate with a supportive team of six professionals.

Our Community

Located in Larkfield, Aylesford, Kent, our practice is deeply rooted in a vibrant and supportive community. The Larkfield Community Group organizes social activities and events to bring residents together, fostering a strong sense of community spirit.

The area offers a variety of clubs, community groups, and leisure activities for all ages, providing ample opportunities for engagement and connection.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset at Chineham Centre Opticians in Basingstoke.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a part-time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in Basingstoke.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Ford, Prodesign, Silhouette, Orégreen
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 6
  • The role requires you to work 2 in 4 Saturdays a month

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £30,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £26,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Julian Davies Opticians are at the forefront of the shared care services across the region.


Each practice provides low vision clinics and a comprehensive range of contact lens fitting (Including Myopia management) services.

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, then we have a really exciting Optical Assistant role for you.


Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skill-set and the opportunity to further your career as a result.


You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.


Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Julian Davies Opticians are looking for a full or part time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

As an optical assistant, there is a fantastic opportunity for growth and learning within optics to further your career.

Additional Information:

  • We are a really friendly well established team who will be happy to pass on a wealth of knowledge
  • Some Saturday work may be required
  • Optical background preferred but not essential
  • High level of customer service experience required

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £12.21

Salary – Min

GBP £12.21

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

As an Optical Assistant with some experience, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Ford, Gucci, Versace, Silhouette amongst others
  • We have 3 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 7

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Urban Optics, we are committed to providing our patients with a highly professional standard of eye care by investing in the best optical technology and providing a wide range of visual correction options to suit all our patients’ needs.

​​

The ethos of the practice has always been about providing excellent patient care, something we strive to do from when you first arrive, through the examination and dispense, to when you walk out the door.

We are looking for a full-time Dispensing Optician or an experienced Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 5
  • The role requires you to work Saturdays

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

#INDHP

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €35,000.00

Salary – Min

EUR €25,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Join Our Passionate Team of Optometrists at Haine & Smith!

Haine & Smith’s vision is to be the most trusted optician, who goes further than any other in pursuit of providing the best quality eyecare. You will be part of an enthusiastic and friendly team committed to providing patients with excellent personal service and good quality eye wear. You will often be working with qualified dispensing opticians and our practice teams are well trained. Established in 1975, we are committed to ensuring our staff are motivated and happy in their roles. At the centre of this is investing in each and every individual that works for us and we offer paid time for CPD events. Our modern practices are often located within attractive rural market towns, where it is not unusual for us to look after three or even four generations of the same family.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Why Choose Us?

  • Work in Independent Practice Settings: Our practices are located in beautiful rural market towns, where you’ll have the pleasure of caring for multiple generations of loyal patients.
  • Flexibility on Location: With practices spread across the region, we offer flexibility in your working location to suit your needs.
  • Additional Support from Hakim Group: As part of Hakim Group, you’ll have access to a vast network of resources, professional support, and a wealth of expertise to help you thrive in your role.
  • Paid Birthday Off: Celebrate your special day with a paid day off—because we believe in work-life balance and rewarding our team.
  • No Sundays or Evenings: Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with no Sunday, Bank Holiday, or evening shifts. Our hours are Monday–Saturday, 9am-5:30pm.
  • Flexibility in Work Packages: We understand the importance of flexibility, so we offer packages tailored to fit your lifestyle and career goals

What We Offer:

  • Modern, well-equipped practices with fundus cameras and expanding OCT technology.
  • 30-35 minute testing times, giving you the opportunity to provide thorough, exceptional care.
  • A highly trained support team that handles pre-screening, allowing you to focus on your patients.
  • Access to a wide range of premium lenses, including Nikon, Hoya, and Shamir, along with advanced myopia control options.
  • The opportunity to participate in post-cataract follow-up schemes.
  • Ongoing Development: We’re committed to your growth with paid time for CPD events and regular learning opportunities, often with local hospital consultants.
  • Relocation Support if you are thinking of moving to the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Spurretts Opticians was established over 30 years ago, and we have been in our current location on Brackley Street in Farnworth for 15 years. We are committed to delivering first-class service to our community, and you can be sure of a friendly welcome at our practice.

We are looking for a part time (3 days) Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

Your working weekly hours will be 22.5 hours. We need someone to work every Saturday and Mondays and alternate Fridays. We can be flexible on the other day.

You will be an integral part of our team, helping us drive our service offering forward and always seeking opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and taking the time needed to fully understand their visual needs.

About Us

We are a small, well-established community practice, offering a friendly, professional, and personalised service to all our patients.

Customer service is at the forefront of everything we stand for.

  • This role requires you to work on Saturdays.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £12.21

Salary – Min

GBP £12.21
