title.rendered: Mobile Optical Assistant job in Ampthill

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Mobile Optical Assistant at Allders

With roots dating back to 1905, Allders Opticians has been a trusted name in eye care for over a century. Starting as a small optician and jeweller in Luton, we’ve grown into 10 modern practices across Bedfordshire, Hertfordshire, and Cambridgeshire, blending heritage charm with cutting-edge facilities. We are opening our doors to an Optometrist to complete the team at our Sandy branch.

Allders Opticians, Sandy, has been established since 1964, and we’re committed to delivering exceptional care while supporting our team with a great work-life balance — We don’t open on Sundays or bank holidays and offer early finishes on Saturdays. Join us and become part of a proud history while shaping the future of our group. At Allders Opticians, we embrace the synergy of heritage and modernity. With an ongoing program of branch refits, we are committed to providing a contemporary and comfortable environment for our customers while upholding the values that have been our foundation for over a century.

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Mobile Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

Duties within the role include

Exceptional customer service skills – this includes patient queries, a welcoming telephone manner, pre-examinations and dispensing spectacles.

Product awareness – this includes maintaining awareness of new lenses, contact lenses and frames, teaching patients how to use contact lenses and being familiar with Rodenstock prices and promotions

Practice presentation – this includes ensuring the practice is kept clean, tidy and welcoming and merchandising.

Administration – this includes filing, efficient record-keeping, manage booking appointments and the use of a computerised systemPersonal development – this includes communicating with the practice manager on self development and embracing training, seminars and any internal Allders activity

Skills and interpersonal attributes · Written and verbal interpersonal communication skills, strong maths skills, professional and reliable, courteous and able to maintain confidential patient information

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Silhouette, TIFFANY&CO, Ray-ban and more
  • The role requires you to work alternate Saturdays
  • The role requires you to work across all Allders practices which include Ampthill, Barton, Biggleswade, Dunstable, Flickwick, Harpenden, Leighton Buzzard, Letchworth, Sandy and St Neots.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

#INDETF

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £26,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £24,000.00

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Cadman Visioncare, we believe in building relationships that last, often serving multiple generations of the same family. Our patients reflect the vibrant diversity of Chorlton, with people of all ages, backgrounds, and cultures visiting us for high-quality, personalised eye care.

We’re proud to be a part of this unique neighbourhood, a thriving area filled with independent businesses, creative energy, and a strong community spirit.

We are looking for a full or part time professional, pro active and personable Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • The role requires you to work 3 in 4 Saturdays a month

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

#INDHP

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £12.21

Salary – Min

GBP £12.21

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Experienced Optometrist – The Eyecare Centre, Hove

Future Partnership Opportunity

We’re looking for an experienced Optometrist to join our well-established independent practice in Hove. This part-time role (3-4 days per week, including some Saturdays) offers a clear pathway to Joint Venture Partnership for the right candidate.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

About Us

Founded in the 1950s, The Eyecare Centre is the longest established opticians in Brighton and Hove and has been providing exceptional eye care for over 75 years. As an independent practice, we prioritise clinical excellence, patient-first service, and continuous innovation. Our team of 8 professionals works across 3 consulting rooms and ensure a supportive and friendly working environment.

Why Join Us?

  • Patient-focused care – 30-minute test times to fully understand the patient’s visual needs
  • Cutting-edge technology – OCT, Optomap, digital slit lamps, and potential for further investment
  • Curated eyewear selection – Lindberg, Einstoffen, Maui Jim, Prodesign, Woow, Dutz, MODO, Booth and Bruce, Hackett Bespoke
  • Strong community presence – We actively engage with our local area and promote independent eye care
  • Competitive salary DOE & development opportunities, plus a clear route to future partnership

About You

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Balances clinical expertise with commercial awareness
  • Thrives in a patient-first, independent setting
  • Is a brand ambassador who is willing to engage with the local community beyond the normal working environment
  • Wants to help drive innovation and service improvements –someone who is not afraid to take a chance.
  • Has minimum of 3 years practice as an Optometrist

Why Hove?

A vibrant seaside town with great transport links to Brighton and London, offering a perfect mix of coastal living and city convenience.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £58,000.00

title.rendered: Dispensing Optician Practice Manager job in Wilmslow

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

As our new Dispensing Optician Practice Manager, you’ll be equipped with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Wheeldon Opticians is an independent, established eyecare provider with premises in West Didsbury, Cheadle and Wilmslow. Our aim is to provide the highest quality eyecare and outstanding customer service.

Paired with our carefully selected eyewear from your favourite brands, we want to offer you an unforgettable eyecare experience.

We are looking for a full time Dispensing Optician Practice Manager to join us in leading the team to delivering outstanding patient care. This role will be based at our Wilmslow branch, however you will be required to work across all 3 practices as and when required.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Tom Ford RayBan David Beckham
  • We have 1 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 4
  • The role requires you to work every Saturday 9-12.30pm with a full day off every second week

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £32,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £28,000.00

title.rendered: Dispensing Assistant – Maternity cover job in Locksbottom, near Orpington

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

As a Dispensing Assistant or, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a part-time Dispensing Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in Locksbotton, Kent.

This is a maternity cover from August 2025 and will last for 8 months.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes WOOW, GUCCI, Saint Laurent, Tom Ford, Maui Jim
  • We have 1 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 4
  • The role requires you to work Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £30,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £26,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

As one of your 5 senses, vision is a fundamental part of your life.

Situated in Kingsley we provide thorough 45 minute eye tests in a relaxed environment.

We have free parking and offer an unhurried approach for our clients and families.

Set in the beautiful county of Hampshire, Bliinx Eyecare is the communities leading provider of eyecare services.

The Optometrist will be supported by 3 experienced Dispensing Opticians in a beautiful, relaxed barn setting.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Bliinx Eyecare is part of the Hakim Group. It is an Opticians situated in Kingsley focusing on high levels of service to patients. We provide thorough 45 minute NHS & Private eye tests in a relaxed environment, with free parking and refreshments.We’re looking for a part time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care at Bliinx Eyecare, 3 days a week.

You’ll be an integral part of our experienced team and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We have the freedom to choose what brands and styles we stock. As well as frames from designers such as Woow, Gotti, Ray Ban, Oakley, Calvin Klein & Karl Lagerfeld we stock exciting frames from smaller designers such as Outspoken, Prodesign & Stepper. Our collection continually evolves and approximately a quarter of our frame selection is sustainable eco friendly eyewear.

​

We use Hoya lenses in our frames. Known in the industry for their high quality they consistently provide us with excellent varifocal and single vision lenses.

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 45 minutes
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT
  • We are a team of 7; including 2 Optometrists, 3 Dispensing Opticians and 2 Receptionists
  • The role requires you to work 2 in 4 Saturdays a month.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £62,000.00

What’s in it for you?

Timlins Optometrists are seeking a full time Optometrist to join the team

Timlins Optometrists is a long-established, family-run practice with a proud history of delivering exceptional eye care services to the local community. Since our founding in 1984, we’ve built a reputation for providing personalised, high-quality care to patients across the North East.

Our friendly and professional team is dedicated to offering the latest in clinical expertise alongside expert eye-wear styling advice. We prioritise patient care and satisfaction, from thorough eye health assessments to helping patients find frames and lenses that suit their individual needs and style.

At Timlins, we pride ourselves on being more than just an optician – we’re a trusted part of our community. Our practice combines cutting-edge technology with a warm, welcoming environment to ensure every patient feels valued and cared for.

If you’re looking to join a passionate, patient-focused team and want to be part of a practice that is as committed to your growth as it is to delivering outstanding care, we’d love to hear from you.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

GBP £65,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Optometrist – Join Our Team at Pritchard Cowburn Opticians, Narberth

Are you a qualified Optometrist looking to be part of a well-established, patient-focused practice? At Pritchard Cowburn Opticians, we have been delivering expert eye care in West Wales for over 60 years. Our Narberth practice is known for its clinical excellence, high-quality eyewear, and dedicated approach to patient care.

This is a part-time role over two days a week, with no weekend work, offering a great work-life balance in a friendly and professional environment. If you’re passionate about clinical recision, providing tailored patient focused optical solutions, and working within a supportive team, we’d love to hear from you!

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a part time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care over 2 days per week. There is the opportunity for a full time role split between the Narberth and Cardigan practices also.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • We are a team of 5 plus a wider team in our sister practice in Cardigan
  • The role does not require weekend availability

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £60,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Full time Dispensing Optician

Pagan & McQuade Opticians has been providing quality eyecare to the Scarborough community since 1988. As a trusted, independent practice, we are dedicated to offering exceptional eye care with a focus on personalised service and the latest technology including Optomap which offers a deeper and more thorough eye examination compared to standard practices. Our goal is to help our clients not only see better but live their best lives with eyewear that fits their individual style and needs.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Oakley, Gucci & Face a Face
  • Two consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 8
  • The role requires you to work Saturdays

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £30,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £28,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Enfield opticians your leading local independent optical and eyewear practice. We know times have been tough and it’s often hard to find funds for the essentials, which is why we don’t think you have to miss out on quality regardless of budget.

We’re looking for a full-time or part-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40mins
  • We have 1 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT, autorefractor, Vision R800 Phoropter, icare tonometer
  • We are a team of 4
  • The role requires you to work alternate Saturdays

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €75,000.00

Salary – Min

EUR €65,000.00

title.rendered: Dispensing Optician/Experienced Optical Assistant job in Sleaford

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

At Lunettes, we care about eye health and about you as an individual. We place great emphasis on providing personalised eyecare appropriate for each patient using the latest techniques with modern state of the art equipment. We are now looking for a Dispensing Optician to complete our team of enthusiastic eye care experts.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too. We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Dispensing Optician or an Experienced Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Oakley, Ray-Ban, Tom Ford and more
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 5, however we have a wider team based in our Grantham and Ruskington practices
  • The role requires you to work alternate Saturdays

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Alan Miller Opticians, our friendly local staff bring a wealth of experience and deep knowledge from the optical industry directly to our community.
We are equipped with the latest, state-of-the-art technology that allows us to customize each eye examination according to your individual needs.
Whether it’s your first visit or you’re a familiar face, our dedicated team is committed to ensuring that your eye care experience is both comprehensive and tailored to you.

We are looking for a full-time qualified Dispensing Optician or experienced Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Additional Information:

  • The role requires you to work 3 in 4 Saturdays a month

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £28,500.00

Salary – Min

GBP £26,500.00

title.rendered: Optical Clinical Assistant job in London

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Join Barnard Levit: Award-Winning Opticians in Northwest London

We are looking for a full-time Clinical Assistant to join our team in delivering outstanding patient care. This role requires availability every Sunday; however, we are closed on Saturdays.

About the Role

As a Clinical Assistant, you will:

  • Support our Optometrists with preliminary tests.
  • Assist with dispensing and receptionist tasks.
  • Deliver exceptional customer service with strong attention to detail.

Previous experience in the optical industry is not essential, as full training will be provided. However, proven experience in a customer-facing, clinical, or medical environment is desirable.

You will have access to state-of-the-art technology, including:

  • iProfiler, Optomap, OCT (Optical Coherence Tomography), Visual Field Testing, Valeda Treatment Light Therapy System (RPE)

What We’re Looking For

Equally as important as technical skills is how you interact with our patients. We’re looking for someone who:

  • Provides a friendly, informative, and empathetic service.
  • Acts as a brand ambassador, representing both our practice and the profession within the local community.
  • Shares our passion for educating patients on the benefits of independent eye care and is excited to embrace this challenge.

If you’re ready to be part of an award-winning team and make a real impact in your community, we’d love to hear from you!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £29,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £26,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Your Practice, Your Vision:

Hakim Group is a support structure designed to make your ambitions come to life. We aren’t here to dictate your business strategy we’re here to redefine what independents can achieve.

A Growing Investment:

All the practices we support are profitable and see growing returns over time. This means less risk with your money and a higher chance of increasing dividends.

You will also receive:

  • A Marketing Department
  • An HR & Payroll Department
  • A Finance Department
  • An I.T Department
  • An Operations Department
  • A Buying Team
  • A Legal Team
  • A Dedicated Practice Mentor

About the Role

Tracy Vanderplank Opticians has been providing professional eye care services in the Isle of Man for over 30 years.

​

The practice was established in 2019 to enable Tracy and her team to continue to provide first class eye care services to their existing patients and to look after new patients who appreciate the personal service that they provide.

We are seeking an ambitious and driven Optometrist who has a vision to become a Joint Venture Partner Optometrist (JVP).

The Isle of Man has so much to offer its residents; from exceptional employment opportunities, a vibrant cultural scene, to stunning landscapes, here Locate countdown five reasons why you should consider relocating.

For us, this is what being a JVP Optometrist is all about:

  • Becoming a leader
  • Creating and nurturing innovation
  • Constant and never-ending improvement
  • Playing as a team
  • Communication, communication, communication

If you are enjoying yourself, learning, and your team is happy to come into work every day to deliver an exceptional patient experience – that, for us, is true success.

It’s not work if you love what you do, and it’s our job to make that happen!

What’s Next?

If you are interested in becoming a JVP with Hakim Group and being the Director of your dream practice – click apply below, and a member of our team will contact you with more information!

Salary – Max

GBP £70,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £65,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

You will also receive:

  • No weekend working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Purcell Opticians, we are a proud independent eyecare specialist based in Castle Douglas, Dumfriesshire. Established in 2007 by Jim and Janice Purcell, we’ve been serving the optical needs of our community for nearly two decades. Our mission is simple: to make a real difference in people’s lives by improving their vision.

As a values-driven business, we focus on:

  • We Can Attitude
  • Attention to Detail
  • Care & Community
  • Responsibility

We are looking for a passionate and driven Optometrist to join our dedicated team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with the latest clinical equipment in a well-established, thriving practice.

  • As part of the Urquhart’s Group, we offer a supportive environment where you can develop both clinically and professionally. Whether you’re looking to pursue management or independent prescribing qualifications, we will help you achieve your goals.

  • You will have access to the latest diagnostic technology, including OCT and Topography, as well as participating in local shared care schemes across Dumfries and Galloway.

  • You’ll be part of a close-knit team of optometrists and optical professionals, supported by a strong business management function. We’re here to help you focus on what you do best – delivering exceptional patient care.

  • Our flexible working hours (3-5 days a week) give you the freedom to maintain a healthy work-life balance.

  • Future Career Opportunities: This role offers significant career progression within our growing practice, with the possibility to take on greater responsibilities as we expand.

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualities:

  • Positive and Can-Do Attitude: You’re eager to make a difference and contribute to the success of the practice.
  • Passion for Patient Care: You’re committed to exceeding patient expectations and delivering exceptional service.
  • A Team Player: You thrive in a collaborative, supportive environment and can work well under pressure.
  • Excellent Communication Skills: You’re confident in offering solutions and recommendations tailored to patients’ lifestyle needs.

The Role:

  • Clinical Focus: Our practice is fully equipped with OCT, Optomap, and other leading-edge diagnostic tools. We offer 30-minute test times to ensure thorough, comprehensive eye exams for every patient.

  • Community Engagement: As a local independent, the Castle Douglas community is at the heart of everything we do. You will see the real impact your work has on those around you.

Additional Information:

  • Test times: 30 minutes
  • Testing equipment: OCT, Optomap
  • Consulting rooms: 2
  • Team: A small, dedicated team of 8 professionals
  • Community Focus: We’re actively involved in our local community, which plays a key role in our practice identity.

How to Apply:

If you’re passionate about making a difference in people’s lives and want to be part of an aspirational, values-driven team, we would love to hear from you.

Please send your CV and a Covering Letter to:


mitchell@purcellopticians.co.uk

In your cover letter, tell us why you would be a valuable addition to Purcell Opticians and how you align with our mission and values.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £55,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £49,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

What’s Ollie Quinn all about?

It’s pretty simple, we’re an affordable one stop optical shop committed to great customer service and a relaxed environment.

We believe in a quality product that doesn’t break the bank, and in being an active member of our communities. To our customers and employees our message is simple, we want to help you Create Your Own Vision.

What are we looking for?

Flexible and driven

Whatever role you’re in at Ollie Quinn, there’s always room to innovate. We look for people who can’t sit still, who bring passion to everything they do, and who above all else want to change their environments for the better! There are no bad ideas.

Inclusive and Accountable

We’re a lean, mean, optical machine. We believe that results speak for themselves, and we’re not too concerned with titles or ties. What you get done at OQ will be the only stick you are measured by, not how you present. If you are looking to be a layer of management, we are not the place for you but if you want responsibility and accountability to own an area, we just might be.

Risk-taking creatives

We take risks and we are always creative when it comes to solving our customers’ problems. We believe being creative means you can see the big picture, and bring unique and innovative approaches to overcome the challenges along the way. We want you to bring your epic personality and problem solving skills to work with you everyday.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Store Manager to join us in leading the team to deliver outstanding patient care 5 days a week in Stoke Newington.
This includes at least one weekend day.

You will be an integral part of our leadership team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

High performance lenses and coatings are included in the price.

Our frames are manufactured from quality acetate and stainless steel.

All of our sunglasses come polarised as standard, With complete UVA and UVB protection.

Oh, and we design them all ourselves

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £29,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £29,000.00

title.rendered: Locum Talent Partner job in Darwen

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Hakim Group are the fastest growing group of independent opticians in the UK and have achieved this by staying true to our award-winning values of being honest, ambitious, kind, industrious and meticulous.

Our people are the lifeblood of our business. We provide you with the tools to thrive in your role, providing you with a career structure designed to help you achieve your dreams and become the best version of yourself possible.

As our Locum Talent Partner, you’ll ideally be a hybrid worker spending 3 days per week in Darwen BB3 1AE

You will also receive:

We offer a range of fantastic perks including a calendar of exciting events, an employee health plan, access to our financial flexibility fund and Rewards portal. You’ll also be embraced by our ever-expanding family of team members and introduced to our award-winning Hakim Group culture.

About the Role

As our Locum Talent Partner, you’ll support and enhance the usage of our locum platform, build talent pools, ensure our practices can easily manage their locum requirements, communicate with locums, maintain compliance, and more.

You’ll have the opportunity to continually innovate the ways we work and play a key part in our continued growth.

Key Roles & Responsibilities

You will be part of the internal talent team working closely with our practice partners and area managers to be proactive in understanding future demand and business impact.

Embedding the Locum Platform that we launched recently, building engagement, highlighting best practices, optimising reporting to give us meaningful insights and building a fit for the future simplified locum strategy.

  • Lead the ongoing evolution of the Locum Hub platform, ensuring its strategic alignment with Hakim Group’s broader goals of cost efficiency, talent acquisition, and operational excellence.
  • Drive continuous improvement by analysing locum success, user feedback, and key metrics to enhance performance, engagement, and outcomes.
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to define new features, refine workflows, and ensure the platform delivers maximum value for both practices and locums.
  • Attract and Source quality locums to build an active talent pool of locums
  • Lead the communication plan for locums keeping the talent pool engaged and updating about life at Hakim Group to support permanent employment.
  • Work closely with the compliance team to ensure that practices and locums maintain full regulatory compliance in an efficient, paperless environment.
  • Engage with locums to build a community of highly qualified professionals, facilitating better matches between locums and shifts and promoting long-term partnerships.

The Ideal Candidate

As a recruitment professional, you will understand business challenges and address them with confidence. You will embrace forward-thinking and innovation, consistently seeking improvement while balancing daily tasks with growth initiatives. You will be a natural communicator, personable and capable of interacting with, influencing, and building relationships at all levels. A proven track record in delivering a consistent end-to-end recruitment experience for both candidates and hiring managers is essential.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

What’s Ollie Quinn all about?

It’s pretty simple, we’re an affordable one stop optical shop committed to great customer service and a relaxed environment.

We believe in a quality product that doesn’t break the bank, and in being an active member of our communities. To our customers and employees our message is simple, we want to help you Create Your Own Vision.

What are we looking for?

Flexible and driven

Whatever role you’re in at Ollie Quinn, there’s always room to innovate. We look for people who can’t sit still, who bring passion to everything they do, and who above all else want to change their environments for the better! There are no bad ideas.

Inclusive and Accountable

We’re a lean, mean, optical machine. We believe that results speak for themselves, and we’re not too concerned with titles or ties. What you get done at OQ will be the only stick you are measured by, not how you present. If you are looking to be a layer of management, we are not the place for you but if you want responsibility and accountability to own an area, we just might be.

Risk-taking creatives

We take risks and we are always creative when it comes to solving our customers’ problems. We believe being creative means you can see the big picture, and bring unique and innovative approaches to overcome the challenges along the way. We want you to bring your epic personality and problem solving skills to work with you everyday.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a part-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in Richmond, weekends only.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

High performance lenses and coatings are included in the price.

Our frames are manufactured from quality acetate and stainless steel.

All of our sunglasses come polarised as standard, With complete UVA and UVB protection.

Oh, and we design them all ourselves

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £11.44

Salary – Min

GBP £11.44

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Part time Optometrist at Daybell & Choo

Daybell & Choo are seeking a part time Optometrist to join our leading independent Opticians in Sheffield. We take pride in our reputation for clinical excellence and personal service that puts the customer first. This is an excellent opportunity for an Optometrist to take the next step in their career by joining our luxury practice. We have been offering dedicated caring and professional services, holding a strong reputation for clinical excellence during the past 30 years. You will be responsible for providing the highest quality of eye care to the local community, assisted by our team you will have access to technologies, lens and frame designs which are at the forefront of the profession.

We can provide a multitude of development opportunities to gain the knowledge you require to provide expert, professional eye care services. You must have excellent communication skills, be well-presented, warm and welcoming with the ability to build a rapport with each of our patients.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • 33 days holiday (FTE)

About the Role

We’re looking for a part time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care. Working 31.5 hours per week over 4 days.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • We have 3 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes, Optomap, OCT, Myah, Topography and Visual Fields
  • We are a team of 11
  • The role requires you to work some Saturdays.
  • Salary – £65,000 FTE (based on 38 hours)

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £65,000.00

title.rendered: Experienced Optical Assistant (Maternity Cover) job in Lostock Hall

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Val Hughes Optometrists is a trusted independent optician, committed to delivering outstanding patient care. Situated in the heart of Lostock Hall, Preston, we are known for our friendly, local staff with extensive industry knowledge and a passion for personalized optical care.

We use state-of-the-art technology to ensure that every eye examination is tailored to our patients’ unique needs. Our dedication to high-quality care has built strong connections with our local community, and we are looking for an Optical Assistant to join our team and help continue our commitment to excellence.

Your Role

As an Optical Assistant, you will be an integral part of our team, working to provide an exceptional patient experience. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Assisting patients in selecting eyewear that meets their visual needs and lifestyle.
  • Supporting optometrists in delivering thorough eye examinations.
  • Handling bookings, patient queries, and administrative tasks.
  • Educating patients on the benefits of independent eye care.
  • Promoting our brand and services within the local community.

What We’re Looking For

We are seeking a dedicated professional who shares our passion for putting patients first. You should:

  • Have at least one year of experience as an Optical Assistant.
  • Possess excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to provide a friendly, empathetic, and informative service.
  • Be proactive in seeking opportunities to improve and innovate within your role.
  • An initial contract of 9 to 12 months
  • This role requires working 3-4 days per week, including every Saturday from 9:00 am to 2:00 pm.

Why Join Us?

At Val Hughes Optometrists, we are proud of our independent status and the high-quality care we deliver. We value our local community and are committed to making a positive impact both in practice and beyond.

If you’re passionate about eye care and thrive in a supportive, community-focused environment, we’d love to hear from you!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £12.75

Salary – Min

GBP £12.21

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Are you a skilled and dedicated qualified Dispensing Optician looking for an exciting opportunity in a friendly and professional environment? Keith Murphy Opticians in Kenilworth is seeking a talented and enthusiastic Dispensing Optician to join our reputable team.

Keith Murphy Opticians is a well established practice known for delivering exceptional eye care and personalised service. We pride ourselves on our commitment to patient satisfaction, utilizing the latest technology, and offering a wide range of high quality eyewear. Our team is passionate about providing comprehensive eye care solutions and ensuring the visual health of our community.

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset. We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance. As our new Dispensing Optician, we will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time qualified Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes a range of boutique and designer brands, such as Linberg, Gucci, Tom Ford and more.
  • We have two consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 10
  • This is a full time role, over four days of the week

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £30,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £24,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Our long established family based practices, Cotler and Bell are a group of well respected independent opticians in the local communities of Doncaster and Thorne. We pride ourselves on delivering excellent customer service and patient orientated care.

Each practice sees a variety of patients who have long standing relationships with us and expect a high level of customer care, our new Optometrist will have a keen interest in building long term relationships with our patients and offering a continuously high level of service, supported by our committed practices.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives. You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for an Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • The role may require you to work some saturdays.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

At Flint Optometry, we deliver world class eyecare with a truly international client base.

We are experts in solving complex visual needs and have become a destination practice for members of Royal families, Sports Stars, TV presenters and individuals who want the very best service and products.

Our team places great emphasis on providing personalised eyecare appropriate for each patient using the latest techniques with modern state of the art equipment. We are now looking for a Dispensing Optician to complete our team of enthusiastic and experienced eye care experts.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patients are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too. We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care. This role is suited for someone who is ready to advance their career and become a senior member of our team and step into a shared management role.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate. We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must. Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our carefully curated frame selection includes Mykita, Tom Ford Private Collection, Face a Face, Silhouette and many more.
  • We are a team of 16, across our practices in Codsall, Tettenhall and Wednesfield
  • The role requires you to work some Saturdays

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by a member of our team

Salary – Max

GBP £32,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £29,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Daybell & Choo Optometrists – Full Time Optical Assistant

Daybell & Choo are seeking a full time Optical Assistant to join our leading independent Opticians in Sheffield.

This is an excellent opportunity to become part of a practice who offers dedicated caring and professional services holding a strong reputation for clinical excellence during the past 30 years.

We a looking for an experienced Optical Assistant to undertake, dispensing at all levels, administrative tasks and pre-screening. You must be well-presented, warm and welcoming with the ability to build a rapport with each of our patients.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Lindberg, Orgreen, Gotti, Dior, Tom Ford
  • We have 3 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 11
  • The role may require you to work some Saturdays.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £25,500.00

Salary – Min

GBP £24,500.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Join Our Passionate Team of Optometrists at Hakim Group based in the South West.

Our independent’s vision is to be the most trusted optician, who goes further than any other in pursuit of providing the best quality eyecare. You will be part of an enthusiastic and friendly team committed to providing patients with excellent service and good quality eye wear. You will often be working with qualified dispensing opticians, and our practice teams are well trained.

If you are an ambitious, clinically proficient Optometrist with a flair for delivering both outstanding eye care and exceptional customer service? This is a unique chance to join our high-performing team in Wiltshire.

You will gain experience across multiple practices, and we will look to support your career with higher qualifications should you be interested.

You will also receive:

  • Professional indemnity insurance through FODO
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday working
  • Free & Regular CPD Courses and paid time for CPD
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail Discounts
  • Cycle to Work Scheme
  • Relocation Payment if you are moving to the area

About the Role

Job Title: Optometrist

Location: Wiltshire

Salary: DOE

Hours: Full-time

Benefits:

Competitive package with growth and mentorship opportunities

Opportunities for Professional Growth:

  • Pursue IP accreditation
  • Supervise a pre-registration Optometrist as part of your career development
  • Business mentorship to support your growth

Key Skills and Experience Required:

  • Competency with contact lenses and myopia management
  • Flexibility to adapt to multiple practices
  • A balance of clinical excellence and commercial acumen
  • Registration with the OPERA platform for post cataract care

About the Practices:

Our practices are designed with both the clinician and patient in mind:

  • Our patients are loyal, you will often see 3 or 4 generations of patients
  • Equipped with fundus cameras and expanding OCT technology.
  • Pre-screening done for you by trained Oas
  • We offer myopia management with Stellest lenses and MiSight contact lenses
  • Access to a wide range of premium lenses, including Nikon, Essilor, Zeiss and Shamir

HG Benefits:

  • No Sunday work
  • SPA Day and CPD courses
  • Simply Health and Giftbox rewards

Apply Now!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Are you an ambitious Optometrist with a flair for delivering both outstanding eye care and exceptional customer service?

This is a unique chance to join our high-performing team in Epping with it’s affluent client base and cutting-edge facilities. You could gain experience across multiple practices and even work towards your IP accreditation. For this position, we will accept experience from either a newly qualified optometrist or someone with years of clinical experience; what’s most important to us, is the person and the attitude.

You will also receive:

  • Required professional insurance paid for by practices
  • Your Birthday Off Work
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday working
  • Free & Regular CPD Courses
  • Access to SimplyHealth (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail Discounts
  • Cycle to Work Scheme

About the Role

Job Title: Cptometrist

Location: Epping

Salary: £50,000- £60,000


Hours: Full-time


Benefits: Competitive package with growth and mentorship opportunities

Opportunities for Professional Growth:

  • Pursue IP accreditation
  • Supervise a pre-registration Optometrist as part of your career development (DOE)
  • Business mentorship to support your growth, including possible future partnership down the line!

Key Skills and Experience Required:

  • Competency with contact lenses and myopia management
  • The commitment to continuous improvement both clinically and commercially
  • Flexibility to adapt to new practices if they onboard
  • A balance of clinical excellence and commercial acumen

About the Practices:

Our practices are designed with both the clinician and patient in mind:

  • Well-established with a loyal, affluent clientele (Average Dispense Value of £400+)
  • Equipped with Optix PMS, OCTs, Phoropters, and 40-minute testing slots
  • Pre-screening done for you in 2 out of 3 practices

HG Benefits:

  • Birthday off, No Sunday work
  • SPA paid CPD courses
  • Simply Health and Giftbox rewards

Application Process:

  1. Informal interview
  2. Trial days
  3. Final interview and offer

Are you ready to shape your future, elevate your practice skills, and possibly grow into a partner? Apply now to explore this opportunity further!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £50,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Optometrist – Join the Team at Weygang Opticians!

Are you a qualified Optometrist looking for a rewarding role within a respected independent practice? At Weygang Opticians, we’ve been providing exceptional eye care to the Gloucester community for over 50 years. With five locations across the area, we are committed to offering the highest standard of service, utilizing the latest technology and clinical expertise.

As an Optometrist, you’ll be part of a dedicated team working across our Abbeymead, Churchdown, Hucclecote Road, Quedgeley, and Gloucester practices, providing comprehensive eye examinations and offering tailored solutions to our patients. Your role will include performing detailed eye tests, diagnosing visual impairments, and working with a skilled team to ensure the best possible care for our patients.

If you’re passionate about clinical excellence, enjoy working in a supportive independent environment, and want to make a real difference in people’s lives, we’d love to hear from you! This role will involve working across all five of our locations, providing a diverse and varied workday.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Enhanced Sick Pay and Annual Leave

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • This role offers a variety of equipment, patients as well as a cohesive and supportive team accross the Weygang Opticians group

Salary negotiable based on experience

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

title.rendered: Senior Marketing Executive job in Darwen

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Joining Hakim Group means becoming part of a close-knit family of independent Optical practices across the UK and Ireland.

A career where empowerment, innovation, and unwavering support create a truly fulfilling experience. A career that’s not just fulfilling but a bit like joining an exclusive club of the happiest eye-care professionals.

You will also receive:

  • Exciting calendar of events, fostering a vibrant work culture.
  • Employee health plan to prioritise your well-being.
  • Access to our financial flexibility fund, providing additional support when needed.
  • Rewards portal with exclusive benefits and offers.
  • Embrace a supportive and expanding team, immersing yourself in our award-winning Hakim Group culture.

About the Role

A Senior Marketing Executive at Hakim Group provide support to our Growth team, Head of PR and Communications working alongside the Head of Marketing and Design Team. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in different areas of Marketing.

You’ll have the opportunity to continually innovate the ways we work and play a part in our continued growth.

This role is Hybrid with 3 days per week at our HQ in Darwen. BB3 1AE

Key Roles & Responsibilities

  • You will be working closely with our practice partners, Internal teams and 3rd party providers.
  • Support local marketing strategies to develop and execute impactful marketing campaigns at a local level and coordinate all marketing activity.
  • Take ownership and deliver on marketing projects, from local marketing strategy to social media plans.
  • Manage design, print production and full allocation schedule of POS assets, ensuring correct for market for all featured campaigns in line with the local marketing calendar for the estate.
  • Manage the workload of the Marketing Executive to ensure all objectives are achieved for designated practices.
  • Working with the Design team, brief in creative concepts in line with the local marketing calendar.
  • Evaluation of campaign success and presentation of results internally.
  • Liaising with printers and suppliers to manage print quotes and costs.

The Ideal Candidate

You’ll be customer-focused with great communication skills. You’ll be qualified in marketing with industry experience. Comfortable working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Using your creativity and passion for marketing to support our practices.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £32,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £28,000.00
