content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

Andrew Keirl Opticians is an independent practice known for delivering personalised and high-quality eye care services. Located in Liskeard, a historic market town in Cornwall, the practice serves the local community with a range of optical services, including comprehensive eye exams, eyewear fittings, and contact lens consultations. The team is dedicated to providing a friendly, professional experience for each patient.

Liskeard is easily accessible by car and public transport. It’s close to the A38, offering convenient links to nearby towns such as Plymouth (around 30 minutes’ drive) and other areas of Cornwall. The town also has a well-connected train station, making the commute easier for those traveling from surrounding areas.

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a part-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care 3-4 days a week at our practice in Liskeard, Cornwall.

What you’ll do:

  • Conduct comprehensive eye exams with ample time to give each patient your full attention (40 minutes).
  • Work with modern, advanced equipment like our new Optopol Revo OCT
  • Collaborate with our experienced team of 5
  • Educate and engage with patients on the importance of eye health as a key ambassador for our community practice.
  • Enjoy flexible work arrangements, with flexible start or finish due to commute or child care.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes new Optopol Revo OCT
  • We are a team of 5
  • We are currently closed on weekends; this could be subject to change in the future, due to business growth. Please expect alternate Saturdays, in case our business hours are updated.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Are you passionate about optics and have experience working in a lab? We are looking for a motivated Optical Assistant with previous Lab Technician skills to join our team and contribute to delivering exceptional eye care.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

👓 Optical Assistant Opportunity at Kingshill Opticians 👓

Why Join Us?

🌟 Engaging Patient Care

Assist in providing thorough care by supporting the optometrists with:

Pre-screening patients Managing patient queries Helping to ensure a smooth journey from arrival to aftercare

🤝 A Strong Team Environment

You’ll be part of a skilled and collaborative team including:

3 Optometrists

2 Dispensing Opticians

6 Optical Assistants

This environment ensures everyone plays a vital role in delivering exceptional patient care.

📅 Flexible Working Schedule

Work 5 days a week with 1 weekday off
This role requires you working on Saturdays

Opening Hours are Mon-Fri 9am-6pm, and 9am-5pm on Saturdays.

About Kings Hill

Kings Hill is a thriving, modern village with a vibrant community, excellent local amenities, and beautiful green spaces.

With easy transport links to London, Maidstone, and Tunbridge Wells, it’s an ideal location whether commuting or relocating.

What We’re Looking For

A dedicated Optical Assistant with strong communication skills.

Someone eager to provide outstanding customer service.

A team player who thrives in a professional, patient-focused environment.

A willingness to develop skills and knowledge in optics.
Experience in dispensing is essential, as you’ll have the opportunity to apply and expand your skills in a hands-on, patient-focused environment

What We Offer

Competitive salary

Opportunities for ongoing professional development

Continuous training in the latest optical technology

A friendly, modern, and supportive work environment

Ready to Join Us?

If you’re excited about starting or advancing your career as an Optical Assistant with a dynamic and forward-thinking practice like Kingshill Opticians, we’d love to hear from you!

🔗 Apply now and become part of a team that values your skills, your time, and your passion for patient care.

#OpticalAssistantJobs #KingshillOpticians #IndependentOptometry #PatientCare #CareerOpportunity

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £11.44

Salary – Min

GBP £11.44

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Are you passionate about eye care and dedicated to providing exceptional patient service? Headcorn Eye Centre is looking for a skilled and caring individual to join our friendly team.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

Headcorn Eye Centre is a well-regarded, patient-focused optometry practice known for its personalised care and commitment to eye health.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • We have 3 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT
  • Opportunity for IP
  • The role requires you to work 1 or 2 in 4 Saturdays a month.

Convenient Commuting to Headcorn Eye Centre

Located in the heart of Headcorn, Kent, our practice is easy to reach by various transport options:

  • By Car: With easy access via the A274 and connections to the M20, commuting by car is straightforward. There’s convenient parking available nearby.
  • By Train: Headcorn Railway Station, on the Southeastern Main Line, offers regular services to and from London and Ashford, with the practice just a short walk from the station.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £57,000.00

excerpt.rendered: What’s in it for you? Are you passionate about eye care and dedicated to providing exceptional patient service? Headcorn Eye.

As an independent practice, we are dedicated to providing a personalised service that revolves around your needs. Your eyes are unique, so we believe your eyecare should be too!

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes Optos, OCT, Refractor Heads
  • Monday to Friday – No weekends

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skillset.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in Leyton, London.


Optical World is a lovely practice dispensing high-end brands.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • The role requires you to work alternate Sundays, this might be a subject of change in the near future.

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £35,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £32,000.00

excerpt.rendered: What’s in it for you? This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards.

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Daybell & Choo Optometrists – Full Time Dispensing Optician

Daybell & Choo are seeking a full time Dispensing Optician to join our leading independent Opticians in Sheffield.

A highly established independent practice with a stellar reputation for providing the highest quality eye care and optical products. Our practice is renowned in the Sheffield area for delivering personalised care, and we are committed to offering the latest in eye care technology

This is an excellent opportunity for a Dispensing Optician to take the next step in their career by joining our luxury practice, which has been offering dedicated caring and professional services holding a strong reputation for clinical excellence during the past 30 years. You will be responsible for providing the highest quality of care to the local community, assisted by our team you will have access to technologies, lens and frame designs which are at the forefront of the profession.

We can provide a multitude of development opportunities to gain the knowledge you require to provide expert, professional eyecare services. You must be well-presented, warm and welcoming with the ability to build a rapport with each of our patients.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • 33 days annual leave

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes Dior, Tom Ford, Oliver Peoples, LINDBERG and more
  • The role requires you to work some Saturdays
  • Salary depending on experience

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

#INDETF

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £34,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £30,000.00

title.rendered: Dispensing Optician job in Milton Keynes

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Mobile Dispensing Optician to work flexibly between Bletchley, Newport Pagnel, Stony Stratford, Towcester and Wolverton

DW Roberts Opticians, a trusted and family friendly independent optician, has been proudly serving the local communities for over 60 years. With five well established practices in our group, we provide a comprehensive range of private and NHS services, including sight tests, contact lenses, and an extensive selection of frames and lenses.

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full time Dispensing Optician to join our team.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our frame selection includes silhouette, Wolf and more
  • The role requires you to work Saturdays
  • Salary depending on level of experience

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Experienced Optical Assistants, this is for you. The Observatory Group is hiring!

If you are a current or experienced optical assistant looking to take the next step in your career, then an opportunity in a respected and well known independent group of opticians could be the best step forward for you. If you want to advance your career in a setting that offers easier hours, brilliant experience and knowledge amongst the team, and longer testing times giving you more time with each patient; then we want to hear from you.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular training
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full or part time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care across both our Beccles and Southwold practices.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Please check observatory.co.uk to see more

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £25,500.00

Salary – Min

GBP £22,500.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Alex Gage opticians – Dispensing optician Vacancy

We are looking for a full or part time Dispensing Optician to join our family led practice in delivering outstanding patient care.

Alex Gage is a family Optometrists committed to providing exemplary vision support. Led by a team of experienced professionals, we offer a range of optical services, including eye tests, contact lens fitting, sports vision screening, and advanced imaging technologies. If you’re passionate about optometry and thrive in a family-oriented environment, explore opportunities with us and contribute to our commitment to quality eye care for the whole community.

This is an opportunity for you to work in an environment that recognises and rewards your professional skill-set.

We have a loyal patient database and a wide selection of frames and lenses (including designer brands) with a focus on clinical excellence and high-quality care.

For us, patients come before performance.

As our new Dispensing Optician, this will provide you with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We are looking for a full or part-time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

About the Role

We are looking for someone to work accross our Woodseats and Crosspool practices.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £30,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £28,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Be Part of Allders Opticians’ Legacy

With roots dating back to 1905, Allders Opticians has been a trusted name in eye care for over a century. Starting as a small optician and jeweller in Luton, we’ve grown into 10 modern practices across Bedfordshire, Hertfordshire, and Cambridgeshire, blending heritage charm with cutting-edge facilities. We are opening our doors to an Optometrist to complete the team at our Sandy branch.

Allders Opticians, Sandy, has been established since 1964, and we’re committed to delivering exceptional care while supporting our team with a great work-life balance — We don’t open on Sundays or bank holidays and offer early finishes on Saturdays. Join us and become part of a proud history while shaping the future of our group. At Allders Opticians, we embrace the synergy of heritage and modernity. With an ongoing program of branch refits, we are committed to providing a contemporary and comfortable environment for our customers while upholding the values that have been our foundation for over a century.

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people. Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too. We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • 33 days holiday
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cash-back on health-care purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • GOC Fees paid
  • Free pair of glasses annually
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for an Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care over 3 or 4 days per week.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 30 minutes
  • We are a group of 10 practices with a wonderful wider team
  • The role requires you to alternate Saturdays

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Evans & Hughes Opticians & The Optic Shop

Optometrist vacancy

Are you a dedicated and passionate Optometrist looking to make a real difference in people’s lives? Look no further – an exciting opportunity awaits you at Evans & Hughes Opticians/The Optic Shop!

Why Choose Us?

At Evans & Hughes and Optic Shop, we’ve been providing exceptional eye care to our community since 1949. Our legacy of excellence is built on a foundation of unwavering commitment to our patients. With forward thinking sand patient focused directors, our values of care and compassion have only grown stronger over time.

A Legacy of Care:

For nearly 70 years, we’ve been a cornerstone of eye health in the community. Our team of skilled professionals across nine practices is dedicated to surpassing expectations. From delivering eyewear to those unable to visit us in person, to pursuing advanced qualifications within our teams, we constantly strive to elevate our services.

Patient-Centric Approach:

When you step into our practices, you’ll experience a group that believes in offering more than just eyecare – we provide a personalized experience that puts our patients well-being first, while providing our staff with the time and tools needed to have a positive impact.

Join Our Family:

If you’re passionate about eye health and want to be part of a team that’s making a positive impact on families’ lives, we want to hear from you! As an Optometrist at Evans & Hughes/Optic Shop, you’ll have the chance to work in a supportive and professional environment, enhancing your skills while contributing to our mission of exceptional patient care.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care with a commitment to excellence

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

At Evans & Hughes Opticians/Optic Shop, we’re more than a practice – we’re a family committed to providing top-notch eye care. If you’re ready to embark on a fulfilling journey as an Optometrist with us, apply today and be part of something truly special.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Qualified Optometrist with a commitment to excellence.
  • Empathy and strong communication skills to connect with patients.
  • Willingness to go the extra mile to ensure patient satisfaction, benefiting from generous testing times.
  • Desire to learn and grow within a collaborative team.
  • A level of flexibility to travel between the practices.
  • We can be flexible on location and also working days as we are looking for Full/ Part time.
  • All practices are equipped with OCT/ HFA & Paperless records with DO/OA support.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

If you’re ready to embark on a fulfilling journey as an Optometrist with us, apply today and be part of something truly special.

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

At Bird & Fairley, we pride ourselves on being a community-based practice that truly takes the time to care for our patients.

We offer 40-minute adult eye tests and 20-minute appointments for children, ensuring a thorough and personalised experience.

Our services include MECs and post-cataract appointments, providing comprehensive eye care for our local community.

Located in the affluent area of Loughton, our practice faces a competitive optical market, so we go the extra mile to ensure our patients receive top-notch care.

We need an optometrist who understands the importance of balancing the business side of optometry while offering a personal touch to each patient.

With easy access, we’re just a 12-minute walk from the nearest Central Line station, making commuting convenient.

If you are someone who is passionate about delivering exceptional patient care and can help grow our business in a competitive environment, we’d love to hear from you!

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • Generous Holiday Allowance
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Pension Scheme
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a part-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care, 3 days a week, in Loughton.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes for adults and 20 minutes for children
  • We have 1 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes Trial frames, NidekOCT, Henson 9000 field machine, choice icare or pulsair tonometry
  • We are a small friendly team
  • The role requires you to work 3 in 4 Saturdays a month, and 1 out of 4 Tuesdays.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £55,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Mullins & Henry in Lucan, we are dedicated to attending to our customers’ optical needs from the moment they step into our practice.

There’s something truly special about working in an independent setting, where you can build strong relationships with your patients, shape your practice’s culture, and have a direct impact on the community.

Whether you need an appointment, a simple adjustment to your existing frames, or assistance choosing the perfect frames and lenses, we are here to help. We provide high-quality eye examinations and expert advice, ensuring a seamless and professional experience.

We’re looking for a full-time Joint Venture Partner Optometrist to join our team and help us deliver outstanding patient care.

This role can be based at either of our practices in Rathfarnham, Lucan or Maynooth.

  • Accommodation supplied in Dublin city centre for 1 year
  • Pension
  • Health Insurance
  • Opportunity to become a Joint Venture Partner

If you’re passionate about delivering exceptional patient care and want to be part of a warm, supportive, and forward-thinking team, apply now! We’d love to hear from you!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €70,000.00

Salary – Min

EUR €55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Optometrist

Aaron Optometrists – Ashington

About Us:

Aaron Optometrists in Ashington is a clinically excellent, multi award-winning Independent Optician known for our exceptional clinical offering, comprehensive eye care services, and a stylish selection of eyewear. Established in 1905, we have been reimagining the landscape of Optometric provisions in Northumberland for over 100 years, our team pride themselves in providing high quality and thorough eye-care services, ensuring our patients receive the best possible care from our highly trained and personable team of IP qualified Optometrists and the wider Aarons team.

We are an ambitious group of clinicians and are eager to welcome an Optometrist to our growing team. In line with our wonderful ethos and culture, we are keen to speak to candidates who may be interested in serious career progression and continuity of study, supported by our practice. This role is open to candidates at all levels of qualification, including local students interested in completing their pre-registration period in a prestigious Medical Optometry setting that can offer long term career opportunities.

Overview:

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Optometrist to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for someone looking to start or advance their career in Optometry, with significant opportunities for professional development and career progression available for the right candidate. In return you can expect a welcoming and supportive environment and a degree of flexibility in your work life.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Ongoing training and career pathways
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate. We are looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Full or part time positions available*
  • Our testing times are 35-45 minutes
  • We have 6 consulting rooms
  • We are a team of 18
  • Our equipment includes OCT, Humphrey Visual Fields, Medmont Fields, Scout corneal topographer, Fundus camera. We are currently upgrading our systems to Transferring to Acuitus.
  • The role requires you to work alternate Saturdays

*As we are open for longer days during the week, a full-time role with us constitutes four working days, including an alternate Saturday. This results in an extra-long weekend off on the alternate.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £55,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £50,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Euin Steele and Partners is a long-standing, community-focused optometry practice renowned for providing exceptional eye care. As part of the Hakim Group, the practice benefits from being part of a larger, forward-thinking organization that supports personal and professional development, while still maintaining a strong, local identity.

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in Grays, London.

Grays is well-served by public transport, making commuting to the practice straightforward. The nearest bus stops are just a short walk away, offering regular services across the town and into London.

Grays Train Station is also conveniently located within a 10-15 minute walk from the practice, providing frequent services to London Fenchurch Street, Southend, and other nearby towns, making it ideal for commuters from outside the area.

For those who drive, the practice is easily accessible via the A13 and M25, providing excellent road connections to London and beyond. Parking is available close by, with several car parks within walking distance, ensuring a hassle-free commute for those traveling by car.

By joining Euin Steele and Partners, you’ll be part of a supportive, patient-focused team while enjoying the benefits of being part of the Hakim Group. This means access to cutting-edge resources, professional development opportunities, and a collaborative network of like-minded professionals.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 40 minutes
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT
  • The role requires you to work half day Saturdays

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £50,000.00

What’s in it for you?

Register your interest for our Pre-Reg Talent Pool

Sign up for the opportunity to kick start your optical career and make a real difference in patients lives.

As the UKs largest network of independent practices, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people. Our patients are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to care for your patients eye health whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your Birthday Off Work
  • Competitive Salary
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday working
  • Free & Regular CPD Courses
  • Access to a Health Plan (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail Discounts
  • Cycle to Work Scheme

About the Role

As a Pre-Reg Optometrist join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our wider independent family and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate. You’re someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

We’ll encourage you to develop and grow your skills, providing you with the time and support to excel in your Pre-Reg year. As part of a peer group of colleagues working across a variety of independent practices, you’ll have access to a support group and regular events with leading experts from across the industry.

Our Offer

We are now collecting details of Pre-Reg applicants with an interest in completing their qualification at one of our independent practices, based across the UK. With a view to reach out with more details on our placements soon.

What’s Next?

Please apply to register your interest (don’t worry if you don’t have a CV, you can still join our talent pool without one)

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Register your interest for our Pre-Reg Talent Pool

Sign up for the opportunity to kick start your optical career and make a real difference in patients lives.

As the UKs largest network of independent practices, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people. Our patients are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to care for your patients eye health whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your Birthday Off Work
  • Competitive Salary
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday working
  • Free & Regular CPD Courses
  • Access to a Health Plan (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail Discounts
  • Cycle to Work Scheme

About the Role

As a Pre-Reg Optometrist join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our wider independent family and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate. You’re someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

We’ll encourage you to develop and grow your skills, providing you with the time and support to excel in your Pre-Reg year. As part of a peer group of colleagues working across a variety of independent practices, you’ll have access to a support group and regular events with leading experts from across the industry.

Our Offer

We are now collecting details of Pre-Reg applicants with an interest in completing their qualification at one of our independent practices, based across the UK. With a view to reach out with more details on our placements soon.

What’s Next?

Please apply to register your interest (don’t worry if you don’t have a CV, you can still join our talent pool without one)

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, we can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Enjoy Your Birthday Off – Celebrate your special day with a paid day off, because we believe in work-life balance and making every milestone count!
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday Work – Relish your weekends and holidays with loved ones. We ensure you never have to work on Sundays or bank holidays, keeping your downtime sacred.
  • Complimentary & Ongoing CPD Courses – Stay ahead in your career with free, regular CPD courses. We invest in your growth and success!
  • Simply Health Access – Prioritise your wellbeing with access to Simply Health, allowing you to claim cashback on healthcare purchases and keep your health expenses manageable.
  • Exclusive Retail Discounts – Unlock savings on your everyday shopping with special retail discounts, making life just that little bit sweeter.
  • Cycle to Work Scheme – Embrace a greener, healthier commute with our cycle-to-work program, saving on transport costs while staying fit.
  • We offer flexible working hours, making this role ideal for parents or those seeking a better work-life balance

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care at Matheson Optometrists in either Alresford or Grayshott.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

Matheson Optometrists is known for providing personalised care, tailoring treatments to individual needs, and offering a wide selection of high-quality frames and lenses.

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 45 mins
  • We have 3 consulting rooms across both practices
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT, IPL and Clarus
  • We are a team of 8 across both practices in Grayshott and Alresford
  • The role requires you to work 2 in 4 Saturdays a month.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £50,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

At Eyesite in Weybridge we are now looking for a Dispensing Optician.

Known for our comprehensive eye care services, we provide everything from standard eye tests to advanced diagnostic scans like OCT and Optomap scans, which help in detecting eye conditions early on. We also specialise in a wide range of eyewear, offering designer glasses, contact lenses, and sports eyewear.

Join our friendly and welcoming dispensing team, where you’ll work alongside both experienced and trainee dispensing opticians. Our dedication to exceptional service is reflected in consistently high customer satisfaction, with our dispensing delight survey scoring 4.6/5 and above.

Our patients highly appreciate the expertise and knowledge that our team brings. As an independent practice, we offer a broad selection of frames, sunglasses, and lens brands, supported by the latest visi-office measuring technology, ensuring we meet all eyewear needs with precision.

We take pride in fostering long-term relationships with our patients, many of whom return year after year. This allows you to experience real continuity of care and build meaningful connections.

At our practice, we believe in putting our patients and our team first. We don’t impose unrealistic sales targets; instead, we focus on people who are passionate about their role, their patients, and their colleagues. If you’re committed to delivering high-quality care in a supportive environment, we’d love to have you on board.

You will also receive:

  • Enjoy Your Birthday Off – Celebrate your special day with a paid day off, because we believe in work-life balance and making every milestone count!
  • No Sunday or Bank Holiday Work – Relish your weekends and holidays with loved ones. We ensure you never have to work on Sundays or bank holidays, keeping your downtime sacred.
  • Complimentary & Ongoing CPD Courses – Stay ahead in your career with free, regular CPD courses. We invest in your growth and success!
  • Simply Health Access – Prioritise your wellbeing with access to Simply Health, allowing you to claim cashback on healthcare purchases and keep your health expenses manageable.
  • Exclusive Retail Discounts – Unlock savings on your everyday shopping with special retail discounts, making life just that little bit sweeter.
  • Cycle to Work Scheme – Embrace a greener, healthier commute with our cycle-to-work program, saving on transport costs while staying fit.
  • Incentive program – We offer an exciting incentive program with the potential to earn up to a 10% bonus, rewarding you for your hard work and dedication.
  • Progression in your role – If you’d like to go on the managerial path, we can support you fully.

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

These include dispensing spectacles and sunglasses, managing spectacle collections, making adjustments for comfort and fit, and providing excellent in-room handovers.

You’ll also assist with covering reception, answering phone calls, scheduling appointments, and discussing contact lenses and alternative eye care solutions with patients.

As a key part of our team, you’ll actively contribute to the day-to-day running of the practice, ensuring our patients receive the highest standard of care.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the practice and the local community.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • We are a team of 5
  • We have 1 consulting rooms
  • Our frame and sunglass ranges include Tom Davies, Lindberg, Tom Ford, Rayban, Oakley & Maui Jim.
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT, Optomap, colourimetry & myopia management, we also have a large volume of contact lens patients.
  • The role requires you to work 4 days in the week and every Saturday.
  • Weybridge is served by Weybridge railway station, which has regular services to London Waterloo in about 30-35 minutes.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £31,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £27,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Optometrist Vacancy

SG Marshall – Builth Wells – Sign on bonus

SG Marshall Opticians is a group of independent optical practices established in 1985. As a long-standing independent practice, S G Marshall Opticians is deeply rooted in the local communities of Llandrindod Wells and Builth Wells providing eye care services that are trusted and valued by their patients.

Our team engages in continuous professional development and regular training, ensuring we keep up with changes in both the medical field and in new product development, to benefit our patients.

You will also receive:

  • Your Birthday Off Work
  • No Sunday or Bank Holidays working.
  • Free and regular CPD Courses
  • Retail Discounts
  • Cycle to Work Scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time or part time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must

About Us

S G Marshall is a committed group of practices, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Salary is negotiable based on experience
  • Our test times are 40 minutes for eye exams, we also offer WECS and Low Vision Assessments
  • We have 1-2 consulting rooms at each branch
  • Our testing equipment includes Topcon OCTs and phoropters, Humphrey Fields Analysers, selection of tonometers
  • We are a team of 8
  • The role requires no Saturdays

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £60,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Alexander Kobrin Optometrists, we are passionate about offering high-quality, stylish eyewear and top-tier eye care.

Our commitment to detail ensures every pair of glasses and sunglasses is finished to perfection, using state-of-the-art, computerised processes.

Our optometrists and dispensing opticians are trained to the highest standards and have access to cutting-edge equipment, allowing us to deliver exceptional clinical care.

The Role

We are seeking a full-time Optometrist to join our dedicated team. In this role, you will play a key part in delivering outstanding patient care and contributing to our ongoing mission to elevate the quality of our services.

We value innovative thinking and encourage new ideas to enhance the patient experience.

What We’re Looking For

We are looking for someone who shares our passion for patient-centred care. You will take the time to understand each patient’s unique visual needs, delivering thorough, friendly, and empathetic service.

As a brand ambassador, you’ll educate patients on the importance of comprehensive eye care, helping them appreciate the value of maintaining their visual health. This is a meaningful role where you can make a tangible difference to our patients and the wider community.

Why Join Us?

  • Independent Practice: As a committed, independent practice, patient care is always our top priority.
  • Top-of-the-line Equipment: Work with advanced diagnostic technology to provide a seamless and thorough clinical experience.
  • Extended Testing Times: Our 40-minute appointments ensure you have the time to deliver thoughtful, high-quality care without rushing.
  • Community-Oriented: Join a team that values meaningful connections within the local community and takes pride in the positive impact of their work.

Additional Information

  • Work Schedule: This role requires availability on Saturdays.
  • Modern Facilities: Our four consulting rooms are equipped with the latest technology, ensuring you have everything needed for an exceptional clinical experience.

If you are an Optometrist with a passion for patient care, clinical excellence, and a desire to make a difference, we would love to welcome you to our team!

Join us at Alexander Kobrin Optometrists, where your expertise and dedication will be valued and supported every step of the way.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £70,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Being the only independent practice in Uckfield, we are proudly looking for our next Optical Dispenser to join our family business.

As an independent practice, Barracloughs can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

As our new Dispensing Optician Practice Manager, you’ll be equipped with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

Join us in Uckfield, a lovely town with a rural feel where you have easy links into Tunbridge Wells and London.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Opportunity for an Experienced Optical Assistant in Uckfield!

Are you an optical dispenser looking to be part of a thriving independent practice? We’re searching for a full-time optical dispenser to join our team in Uckfield, a charming town with a rural feel and excellent connections to Tunbridge Wells and London. As Uckfield’s only independent optician, we offer personalised patient care in a beautifully refitted, modern, and comfortable practice.

About the Role

As an Optical Dispenser, you’ll play a pivotal role in leading a small, close-knit team committed to outstanding patient care and professional service. Here’s a look at what the role offers:

  • Engaged and Collaborative Team: Work alongside a Dispensing Optician (DO), a regular optometrist, and two support staff on rotation, with the support of audiology services once a week.
  • Premium Dispensing Tools: The practice includes a Rodenstock Impressionist Mirror to support high-quality, personalised dispensing.
  • Top Designer Selection: Offer patients a diverse mix of frames, including Tom Ford and a blend of modern and traditional styles.

Your Role

As a key role in the practice, you will drive excellence in patient care, and foster a warm, welcoming environment that Uckfield residents can trust. Here’s what we’re looking for:

  • Patient First Approach: Take time to understand and meet each patient’s unique visual needs, offering tailored solutions that keep them coming back.
  • Friendly, Professional Service: Our team prides itself on providing a personable, knowledgeable experience for patients, and we seek someone who shares that dedication.
  • Community Engagement: Become an ambassador for independent eye care in Uckfield, helping us build relationships and enhance our presence within the town.

Why Join Us?

In addition to the unique community and tranquil setting of Uckfield, working with Barracloughs and the Hakim Group offers fantastic professional benefits:

  • Close-Knit Team Environment: Collaborate with skilled, friendly colleagues who are committed to excellence in a supportive work culture.
  • Modern, Comfortable Practice: Refurbished in 2018, our practice has a sleek, modern design that provides an inviting space for both patients and staff.
  • Great Work-Life Balance: Our structured workweek is Tuesday to Saturday (closed Mondays), allowing you to enjoy regular time off while maintaining a steady, five-day schedule.

About Barracloughs and the Hakim Group

As a Barracloughs practice within the Hakim Group, you’ll have access to continuous professional development, a network of support, and opportunities for career growth. The Hakim Group empowers independent practices like ours to thrive by offering resources, innovation, and collaboration while allowing us to maintain our independent identity.

Apply Today!

If you’re ready to be part of leading an independent practice to new heights, make an impact in the Uckfield community, and build a fulfilling career, we’d love to meet you!

#INDHP

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £25,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £25,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

We are proud to be looking for our next Dispensing Optician Practice Manager to join our family business.
You will get the opportunity to work in a very modern store with a lot of potential to put your mark on.

As an independent practice, Barracloughs can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

As our new Dispensing Optician Practice Manager, you’ll be equipped with the freedom, choice, and continuity of care needed to ensure your patients leave with the perfect solution every time.

Join us in Seaford, a lovely town with a rural feel where you have easy links into Brighton and Lewes.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

Join Our Team as a Dispensing Optician Practice Manager in Seaford!

We’re seeking a full-time Dispensing Optician Practice Manager to lead our team in Seaford, delivering outstanding patient care and driving our practice forward. Located in the scenic coastal town of Seaford, you’ll enjoy a unique blend of a close-knit community, stunning seaside views, and easy access to the South Downs National Park, all while building a fulfilling career in eye care.

Why Work with Us?

Barracloughs has proudly served the Seaford community for over 60 years, combining a commitment to stand out patient care with a reputation for quality and excellence. As an independent practice supported by the Hakim Group, you’ll experience the best of both worlds: the close connections of a family-owned business with the professional growth and innovation opportunities provided by a larger network.

Benefits of Working in Seaford

  • Beautiful Coastal Living: Enjoy Seaford’s breathtaking seafront, perfect for relaxing walks and outdoor activities, with the iconic Seven Sisters cliffs nearby.
  • Vibrant Local Community: Seaford offers a charming high street with local shops, cafés, and a friendly, community-focused atmosphere.
  • Convenient Location: With Brighton to the west and Eastbourne to the east, Seaford provides a peaceful retreat with easy access to larger cities when desired.

Additional Perks of the Role

  • Modern Technology & Premium Products: Our practice features a Rodenstock Impressionist Mirror for enhanced dispensing and a curated selection of stylish frames, including Tom Ford and other premium brands.
  • Flexible Work Schedule: Enjoy a structured workweek from Tuesday to Saturday, with Mondays off for a balanced lifestyle.
  • Close-Knit Team Environment: You’ll be joining a team of three, fostering collaboration, support, and a shared commitment to outstanding patient care.

About the Role

As Dispensing Optician Practice Manager, you’ll be an essential part of our leadership team, responsible for driving service excellence and patient satisfaction. We are looking for someone who:

  • Puts Patients First: You’ll take the time needed to understand each patient’s unique visual needs, ensuring they receive tailored solutions.
  • Provides Friendly, Empathetic Service: Our patients return for our warm and welcoming approach, and we’re looking for someone who shares that dedication.
  • Engages with the Community: Act as an ambassador for independent eye care and help us spread awareness of its benefits within the local Seaford community.

The Hakim Group Advantage

Joining Barracloughs through the Hakim Group means you’ll have access to ongoing professional development, a network of supportive peers, and unique career growth opportunities. The Hakim Group offers resources that allow independent practices to thrive while maintaining their unique character and community focus.

Apply Today!

If you’re ready to make a difference in Seaford, working in a role where your expertise and community involvement are truly valued, apply now!

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £33,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £31,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

What’s Ollie Quinn all about?

It’s pretty simple, we’re an affordable one stop optical shop committed to great customer service and a relaxed environment.

We believe in a quality product that doesn’t break the bank, and in being an active member of our communities. To our customers and employees our message is simple, we want to help you Create Your Own Vision.

What are we looking for?

Flexible and driven

Whatever role you’re in at Ollie Quinn, there’s always room to innovate. We look for people who can’t sit still, who bring passion to everything they do, and who above all else want to change their environments for the better! There are no bad ideas.

Inclusive and Accountable

We’re a lean, mean, optical machine. We believe that results speak for themselves, and we’re not too concerned with titles or ties. What you get done at OQ will be the only stick you are measured by, not how you present. If you are looking to be a layer of management, we are not the place for you but if you want responsibility and accountability to own an area, we just might be.

Risk-taking creatives

We take risks and we are always creative when it comes to solving our customers’ problems. We believe being creative means you can see the big picture, and bring unique and innovative approaches to overcome the challenges along the way. We want you to bring your epic personality and problem solving skills to work with you everyday.

You will also receive:

  • We are proud to offer:

    • Fully Kitted out Testing Rooms with Phoropters and Trial Sets
    • A well-trained optical team
    • Casual dress code – we want to see your personality!
    • Simple price points for all frame & lenses
    • Non NHS based practice. Private tests only
    • Relaxed 30 minute Testing Times
    • Great Employee and Family staff discounts
    • Late starting times across the stores, from 10am

About the Role

We’re looking for a part time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in Clapham, London, 4 days a week including Saturdays.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £60,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Evans & Hughes Opticians & The Optic Shop

Optometrist vacancy

Are you a dedicated and passionate Optometrist looking to make a real difference in people’s lives? Look no further – an exciting opportunity awaits you at Evans & Hughes Opticians/The Optic Shop!

Why Choose Us?

At Evans & Hughes and Optic Shop, we’ve been providing exceptional eye care to our community since 1949. Our legacy of excellence is built on a foundation of unwavering commitment to our patients. With forward thinking sand patient focused directors, our values of care and compassion have only grown stronger over time.

A Legacy of Care:

For nearly 70 years, we’ve been a cornerstone of eye health in the community. Our team of skilled professionals across nine practices is dedicated to surpassing expectations. From delivering eyewear to those unable to visit us in person, to pursuing advanced qualifications within our teams, we constantly strive to elevate our services.

Patient-Centric Approach:

When you step into our practices, you’ll experience a group that believes in offering more than just eyecare – we provide a personalized experience that puts our patients well-being first, while providing our staff with the time and tools needed to have a positive impact.

Join Our Family:

If you’re passionate about eye health and want to be part of a team that’s making a positive impact on families’ lives, we want to hear from you! As an Optometrist at Evans & Hughes/Optic Shop, you’ll have the chance to work in a supportive and professional environment, enhancing your skills while contributing to our mission of exceptional patient care.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

We’re looking for a full-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care with a commitment to excellence

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

At Evans & Hughes Opticians/Optic Shop, we’re more than a practice – we’re a family committed to providing top-notch eye care. If you’re ready to embark on a fulfilling journey as an Optometrist with us, apply today and be part of something truly special.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Qualified Optometrist with a commitment to excellence.
  • Empathy and strong communication skills to connect with patients.
  • Willingness to go the extra mile to ensure patient satisfaction, benefiting from generous testing times.
  • Desire to learn and grow within a collaborative team.
  • A level of flexibility to travel between the practices.
  • We can be flexible on location and also working days as we are looking for Full/ Part time.
  • All practices are equipped with OCT/ HFA & Paperless records with DO/OA support.

Our local community is a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

If you’re ready to embark on a fulfilling journey as an Optometrist with us, apply today and be part of something truly special.

Salary – Max

GBP £0.00

Salary – Min

GBP £0.00

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

Dispensing Optician- Join our Team at Memory Opticians

Are you a Dispensing Optician, looking to join a team dedicated to delivering exceptional patient care and service excellence? At Memory Opticians, we’ve been setting the standard for quality eye care since our founding in 1982. Our commitment to providing a unique and memorable patient experience remains steadfast, as we continue to uphold the values instilled by our original founder.

Memory Opticians has been serving the communities of Amesbury, Salisbury, and surrounding areas for over 40 years. Under the leadership of Managing Partner Katie Memory and Optometrist Martin Memory we remain committed to delivering expert optical knowledge combined with the highest standards of patient experience.

As an Dispensing Optician at Memory Opticians, you will:

  • Supply the appropriate eye care to customers after taking into account a person’s lifestyle, current eye health and vocational needs
  • Interpret optical information, advise patients about any spectacle adjustments or repairs
  • Take frame and facial measurements to ensure correct frame fit and positioning
  • Advise patients visiting the practice on a range of eye conditions and offer appropriate advice and guidance, referring them to other eyecare professionals when appropriate.
  • Collaborate with our dedicated team to deliver outstanding patient care.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Attractive welcome bonus of £2000.
  • A pathway to further your career
  • Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.
  • Supportive work environment with a passionate team dedicated to excellence.
  • Join a reputable practice with a long-standing history of award-winning service.

If you’re ready to join a team where you can make a meaningful impact on patients’ lives while advancing your career; we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Memory Opticians. Join us in our mission to help patients See and Be Seen with clarity and confidence. Apply now and become a part of our legacy in the heart of Salisbury.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Welcome Bonus

About the Role

We are looking for a full-time or part-time Dispensing Optician to join us in delivering outstanding patient care.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We are also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first, and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Equally important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Our local community is part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

GBP £37,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £30,000.00
